page.title: 14FARMING- PROVIDENCE PLACE
page.content: We visited Providence Place farm. The farm is 320 acres in all and is now a mixed farm. 100 acres produce barley, 50 acres of wheat, 60 acres of sugar beet and 50 acres for pasture. Maize is also grown for silage. On the farm there are cows, bulls, calves and hundreds of ducks.The ducks are delivered from Kent every Monday at 1 day old. They are killed after 8 weeks. Each week the ducklings move along a pen as they continue to grow and a new group comes along behind. Everything is kept very clean and warm. The farm house is in two parts, one was built about 1600, the latter in 1876. Two people live there, the farmer and his mother and there are three full time and several part time helpers on the farm.
